Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump delivered an address at the
Detroit Economic Club on his vision for the economy. He outlined a series
of ideas including reducing the number of federal income tax brackets from
seven to three, limiting the corporate tax rate to 15 percent, and
eliminating what he said were unnecessary government regulations on
business and industry. He said his plans are aimed at creating jobs and
wealth and fixing a “rigged system” encouraged by the policies put in
place by Presidents Clinton and Obama. He predicted that a Hillary Clinton
presidency would bring four more years of “weakness” and “disaster.”
A coordinated group of protestors interrupted Mr. Trump’s speech more than
a dozen times over the course of his remarks. close
